oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 11 f
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 11 f. Newspaper clipping: Benefit Card Party is Being Arranged.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women; Women's suffrage; Card games;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: BENEFIT CARD IS BEING ARRANGED Money Will be Used to Entertain Suffrage Convention Delegates. A large number of representative women of the city met with Mrs. L. Crozier-French Saturday morning in the parlors of the board cf commerce, when plans were discussed for the entertainment of delegates who will attend the convention of the State Equal Suffrage association, which is to convene in Knoxville the last week in October. The ladies rallied to the call extended by Mrs. French in gratifying numbers, and showed much interest in the convention. It was decided to give a benefit card party for the purpose of raising funds for the entertainment of delegates. This affair will be given on the afternoon of October 8th, at the Lyceum building. About a week after this affair, another entertainment will be given for the same purpose. Details for this have not been settled upon, and its nature will not be disclosed until later. At the meeting Saturday morning, there was general discussion held on how to entertain the guests of the convention.
